thread.title: Libya: Boat Sinks Off Coast, 200 Feared Drowned
thread.title_full: Libya: Boat Sinks Off Coast, 200 Feared Drowned

title: Libya: Boat Sinks Off Coast, 200 Feared Drowned
text:
Africa: India's Generic Drug Wars and What it Means for Africa 
Zuwaya — Libyan authorities were collecting the bodies of migrants who drowned off the Libyan coastal city of Zuwara, with some 200 feared dead on Friday. 
Authorities said two boats capsized with one boat carrying as many as 400 people, about half of them apparently locked in the ship's hold when it capsized. 
Othman Belbeisi, chief of mission for the International Organization for Migration for Libya, said in a statement: "We are still waiting for more details, but we have learned there were 400 people on one of two boats." 
In a separate rescue operation by the Libyan coast guard on Wednesday, UNHCR said 51 people were found dead of suffocation in the hold of a boat, with survivors recounting how smugglers beat them with sticks to keep them under the deck. Libya
